3170 Development: GNSS configuration from firmware 3168; PMS = Full, LNA = Normal
Devices will automatically restart and resume logging after a panic.
3174 Release: Same features as 9002 Weymouth Speed Week, just without the fixed settings.
3175 Release: Fixes issue that could cause mini to lock up and unable to restart, requiring ~24 hours of wait.
9000 Weymouth Speed Week: WSW version of 3170. Latest GNSS configuration and auto-restart.
Fixed settings for all motions; 5Hz, 5kn min, UTC+1, WSW WiFi.
Fixed settings for all minis; Blinker = on.
Fixed settings for WSW motions; name = WSW, speed = knots, distance = km, custom blinkers = last 500m, best 500m, last 250m, best 250m.
9002 Weymouth Speed Week: Correct WiFi password and edition/deletion forbidden. Used for WSW 2022
9003 Weymouth Speed Week: Based on 3175 (release). Fixes issue that could cause mini to lock up and unable to restart, requiring ~24 hours of wait
9004 Weymouth Speed Week: New custom firmware based on 3209. Required for newer Motion minis. Used for WSW 2023
9005 Weymouth Speed Week: New custom firmware based on 3212. Special 2 knot minimum for youths
9007 Weymouth SW (3231): New custom firmware based on 3231. Implements live 2s > 3 knots filter
9008 Weymouth SW (3232): New custom firmware based on 3232. No other changes

Filters.Comment: Ignore logs where the distance (km) or 10s speed (knots) are particularly low

Queuing.Comment: The queue timeout dictates how quickly a worker thread can process the stop event

DetectionThreadPool.Comment: Threads dictates how many motions can be polled concurrently. Interval is the minimum time (s) between each iteration

InspectionThread.Comment: Timeout is for an individual HTTP request (info.json, settings.json and logs.json)

InspectionThreadPool.Comment: Threads dictates how many motions can be inspected concurrently

DownloadThread.Comment: Timeout is for an individual HTTP request (*.oao)

DownloadThreadPool.Comment: Threads dictates how many motions can have their logs downloaded concurrently

DisconnectionThreadPool.Comment: Threads dictates how many motions can be checked concurrently. Interval is the minimum time (s) between each iteration
